quest.name: The Perfect Gift
journal: M'septha has the look of a woman with questions that beg for answers.
objectives: Speak with the Ananta at Vira Nilya.
Obtain resin from the designated location.
Deliver the resin-filled jar to M'septha.

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: Excuse me, misssir. Can you spare a moment?

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: We'll be meeting to barter with the Ananta soon, and I'd like to surprise them with something more than our usual wares. Something special.

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: I'd like to find out what sorts of things they actually need, but they're like to discover my plans if I were to ask them directly. That's where you come in. I need you to go and speak with them for me.

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: No need to question everyone in the village, of course. If you strike up conversation with even five of the Ananta I'm sure you'll learn plenty. Then I can see to preparing goods they'll truly enjoy.

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: Speaking with everyone at Vira Nilya would be overly ambitious. Five of the Ananta should be more than enough to figure out what they're looking for.

dialogue.name: JAYANTI
dialogue.text: Sssorry, but I have no time to talk. I must see to my sssisters' fencing lessons.

dialogue.name: NANDINA
dialogue.text: Hm? We were dissscussing what to do about our upcoming meeting with the M tribe. I made a grievous error taking ssstock of our arrows. I fear we will come up short if sssomething is not done soon.

dialogue.name: MANIK
dialogue.text: I would give anything for a new pair of gloves. My ssskin is quite delicate, you see, and these gloves tend to chafe my arms. Sssadly the thread I need is not easy to come by.

dialogue.name: GARIMA
dialogue.text: Is my trouble written ssso plainly on my face? If you mussst know, I worry the poison we lace our arrows with is too potent.

dialogue.name: GARIMA
dialogue.text: One ssslip of the hand and we would be irreparably ssscarred, forever depriving the world of our unequaled beauty. Jussst the thought of it is too much to bear.

dialogue.name: PRAPTI
dialogue.text: Why do I ssseem so bothered? My sssisters are constantly fawning over me. “How are your ssscales so lussstrous and sssmooth?” “You mussst tell us where you get your rouge.” “I wish I had your hourglasss figure.” <sigh> It'sss not easy being beautiful.

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: Welcome back. I trust your talks with the Ananta were enlightening?

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: I see. I didn't realize their stocks of supplies were so lacking. Anything else?

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: The poison for their arrows is too potent? I imagine such a potential irritant to the skin would prove troublesome when preparing their arrows. Especially given their aversion to anything that might blemish their skin.

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: I've got it! I will make them long gloves to protect against their poisons. They'll need a special coating, and I'll need your help to get it.

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: Take this container to East End and fill it with resin from the trees there. I will see to readying fabric for the gloves.

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: The resin from the trees of East End is quite resilient. The Ananta will have nothing to fear with gloves using that as a protective coating.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You tap the tree, but it fails to yield any resin.

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: How did you fare at East End?

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: Good, good. This is more than enough. The Ananta will be quite pleased.

dialogue.name: MSEPTHA
dialogue.text: You may be surprised to know that we've had altercations with the Ananta a time or two over territory disputes. Thankfully we've managed to settle things, and this bartering of goods helps maintain good relations. Thanks to you, we can keep doing just that.
